row.eventText: Which one of the following can protect a computer from the risk of unwanted emails?
row.eventFeedback: Incognito mode does not change how emails are handled

row.eventText: Someone at your school asks for your password.
row.eventFeedback: Passwords exist to ensure only you can enter the program

row.eventText: What username is better?
row.eventFeedback: Usernames should not reveal any clues

row.eventText: Login to bank at school?
row.eventFeedback: Open internet connections can be dangerous

row.eventText: Popup *Download New Flash Player* On a games website someone from your school recommended to you
row.eventFeedback: Downloading from unknown websites can be dangerous!

row.eventText: Would you use online banking while at home, connected to your local router?
row.eventFeedback: Is the connection safe?

row.eventText: Email - "Hey bro, can you click this link, I dont use computers ever and I dont know what to do"
row.eventFeedback: Do not click links from people that you do not trust

row.eventText: What characters should exists in a password
row.eventFeedback: Words that are not guessable are harder to remember/guess.
row.choiceOne: Lowercase and uppercase characters, a number and a special character
row.choiceTwo: Capital letter, lowercase, and 5 random numbers

row.eventText: When you are filling out a form/survey online, how do you answer the questions?
row.eventFeedback: Do you trust the website enough to share your personal information
row.choiceTwo: Check with parent/guardian before sharing information online

row.eventText: you get an email from an unknown email address. What do you do?
row.eventFeedback: Are you aware what is attached to the Email?
row.choiceOne: Respond to the email and start a converstation
row.choiceTwo: Ignore it, place it in the trash folder

row.eventText: You recieve an email with an attachment that you were not expecting from a friend
row.eventFeedback: Could the attached document harm your computer?
row.choiceOne: Ask your parents if it is okay to open the attachment

row.eventText: Should your online identity/username be able to identify your gender?
row.eventFeedback: Sharing information online can be dangerous

row.eventText: Would you post personal information of yours or anyone else without their consent
row.eventFeedback: Once an item is uploaded it can not be deleted.

row.eventText: Would you complete a survey/profile page without your parents guardians
row.eventFeedback: Do you feel safe sharing this information?

row.eventText: Would you give someone you meet in a chat room your phone number?
row.eventFeedback: Do you know what they can do with this information?

row.eventText: Would you send a digital picture of yourself to someone you met in a chatroom
row.eventFeedback: Have you checked with your parents?

row.eventText: You are on a visiting a site from a company or organization that I've heard of. They want my name and phone number so I can enter a contest. Is it OK to enter?
row.eventFeedback: Have you checked with your parents? The site might be a scam

row.eventText: Hyperlink: BUY CHEAP COOL GAMES NOW!!!!!!!!! - Che4pGames.com
row.eventFeedback: Do you believe that this is a trustworth site?

row.eventText: 'I HATE YOU' - Sandra
row.eventFeedback: Take action this is bullying, talk to people to find a solution and stop the mean messages.

row.eventText: Email "Click this link for free money" - Paypal
row.eventFeedback: If an seems offer is too good to be true then sometime it is.
row.choiceTwo: Ignore it, place it in the trash folder

row.eventText: "I sent you a picture of my dog on outlook, check it out" - Bradley from Computing
row.eventFeedback: Opening emails from people you trust is fine. You should trust your class mates.
